reviews.review_msg: I'm quite late but I had Daria for 140 as well as 141, while the course is structured to be quite brutal, I believe it teaches students to learn to how to learn at their own self pace and how to work with others and structure good reports. Make sure to read the textbook before class though because it helps a lot.

Bless Daria's soul, this class is  not for the weak. its structured for you to do textbook readings before class and labs each day in class. it is tough to fully grasp all concepts if you do not particularly learn best that way, however, daria truly cares and is very inspirational and motivational to have everyone try, and do their absolute best

I took phys 140 in fall 24' and it was definitely a roller coaster to say the least. there are few lectures, but the course is mainly taught through reading the textbook before classtime and labs during classtime. it too a very long time to change my way of learning to fit the structure of the class, but overall, Daria is an amazing prof

Overall, very kind and caring prof, very lenient with deadlines and likes to listen to student opinion. The overall grade breakdown of the class is really fair, exams fit perfectly within allotted time and they were extremely fair in content. Only issue was that the labs would often be too lengthy, overall great prof.

Daria could be the worst prof a student can run into. She is difficult to reach out to. She makes her students go through tedious and overwhelming in-class activities while giving very little to lecturing itself. Her midterms is another   story; they can be quite lengthy compared to the given time. Don't recommend her at all!

I don't understand how this prof is even allowed to teach a subject like physics. She seems so lazy to teach. She goes thru the lecture notes really quick, just to leave her students do the lengthy in-class activities/lab with almost very little knowledge of the concepts and the physics behind them. And they are done three times a week!

Not surprised that the class average is B-, though it could have been lower if it wasn't for the curve. Daria does not seem to care about her students success or even their understanding of the subject. A very bad and lame prof!

Well all the profs I have came across did  a way better job in lecturing, and explaining the material/concepts. Her lecture notes are vague and confusing! Try to avoid her whenever you can unless you want to grind through the course material for almost the whole semester to understand it all by yourself :)

Her midterms are difficult no matter how hard you study, as the easy sample midterms she posts on canvas do not reflect the real difficulity of the actual midterm itself! Her lecture notes are not much of a help either!

Such a lame  professor! Her lecture notes are confusing; they are not written professionally and clearly, so get ready to read through the textbook even though it's not as helpful as you may think. She rushes through the course material just to get us do the lab/activities for most of the lecture! Also she does not bother replying to emails at all!

What a horrible course and prof! The lecture notes are nothing more than scribbles! Only the first few minutes of the lecture (usually a maximum of 10-15 minutes) are dedicated to lecturing, while the rest (~ 95 minutes) are spent on labs/activities. Get ready to go through these unnecessarily long and tedious activities three times a week!

Daria is kind and this class is very fun as it is all just group work. You have to teach yourself with the textbook and labs because the lectures on complex topics are only about 10 minutes. The tests are difficult if you don't understand the material fully.

Virtually the same as PHYS140 with labs and a final project except with the addition of a lab test and different material. Dr A herself is a pretty friendly and chill prof but like 140 expects you to read the textbook each class and unlike 140 you are pretty screwed if you don't because the material is pretty theoretical. Otherwise cool class.
Im not the biggest fan of the experimental learning type classes. But, it's a lot of fun when you understand everything.

Daria is great at teaching, however, I did not like the style of the class being that everything is a group activity with a minimal lecture, meaning that you had to figure out most things on your own. The class is not hard if you've taken Physics 100, but I would have preferred more lectures than activities. ExpertTA homework is very tedious.

Dr. A is a nice and laid-back professor. Before each class, you must read the textbook and write a quiz on the material. Then in class, you perform a lab. Dr A will do a summary of the textbook material before the lab but you're expected to read the textbook (most people don't). Not a hard course if you do things on time and practice the material.

Every class is a mini-lab and the goal is to discover the solution yourself. Of course there's TAs and her ready to help. If you ever have a question ask her and she'll explain it one-on-one much better than a lecture in my experience. Easy on grading, focused on your learning - exactly the kind of professor SFU needs more of!
I used to love Physics until I met her.

She cares about her students and isn't strict with due dates. Classes themselves were not bad, some simple experiments and a short informal report...but midterms were a disaster. The questions are completely different from the ones she gives you in class, and she doesn't give you too many to begin with. The textbook isn't very helpful either.

One of my favorite profs!! We used a flipped classroom where we taught ourselves the material and then she explained what was didnt understand in lecture and it worked really well. Her explanations make even complicated stuff seem easy and all exam questions are similar to the worksheets! If you are willing to participate you will do great

The majority of her classes were spent doing I clicker questions (worth over 200 marks) and deriving random equations where you'd need knowledge in calculus to know what's going on. Mind you this was a physics 12 class... To be fair she was very accommodating when it came to pushing back due dates but she teaches you nothing for the midterm+final.

She means well and is super accommodating if you have other assignments/exams with similar due dates. Her teaching method is not amazing and she focuses a lot on deriving formulas and overcomplicates a lot of simple concepts. She said she believes that the exams should be easier than the homework. If you do the homework, the class is an easy A/B

She's very nice. But not a teaching style that works for everyone and her notes are often illegible. Most classes are a mix of iclicker questions and her working through problems. Don't expect her to teach you the concepts! Exams are surprisingly easy compared to the sapling (online) questions. Labs are super easy, basically just attendance marks.
